meanings.definition: Make false and defamatory statements about someone.
meanings.sent1: She was calumniating her coworker by spreading lies about him.
meanings.sent2: The politician was accused of calumniating his opponent during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The gossiping parrot in the pet store was calumniating the other birds.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds calumniating the sunny day with their ominous presence.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie was calumniating the hero to turn the townspeople against him.

meanings.sent1: The lawsuit was filed for calumniating the reputation of the company.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid published calumniating stories about the celebrity.
meanings.sent3: The comedy show featured a hilarious skit about a calumniating newspaper.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti on the wall was a calumniating attack on the local government.
meanings.sent5: The book was filled with calumniating accusations that kept the readers on edge.
